intro: Stenosemis caffra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually violet or purple in color, with five petals that are slightly curled at the edges. Stenosemis caffra is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
